column4: i can't even nuke gnome. it says it isn't installed if i look in synaptic
but all sorts of gnome things are installed
i'm not using kde although there were two applications installed that use kde4 libraries. i got rid of them because i thought the settings write problems were because of a kde/gnome conflict
I also had that result of my problem.. Like i said, I just wiped the whole OS. Have you tried running the dpkg tool at single uyser mode?
